alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 10:57AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Seminole, southeastern Lincoln and northeastern Pottawatomie Counties through 1130 AM CDT... At 1054 AM CDT, radar indicated thunderstorms extending from Shawnee northeast to Johnson and Praque. The storms are moving northeast at 40 mph, but additional storms are forming to the southwest. Although heavy rainfall and flooding is the main concern, a few storms may produce half inch hail and gusty winds. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shawnee, Tecumseh, Prague, Johnson, Little, Aydelotte and Centerview. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 181 and 206. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
